title: Spanish Flan Recipe
description: Spanish flan is a baked custard made with condensed and evaporated milk, eggs, and sugar for a rich, smooth dessert smothered with caramel sauce.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Custards and Puddings Flan Recipes Spanish Flan 4.8 (1,162) 924 Reviews 269 Photos This flan is delicious and a family favorite ‚Äî it's easy to make and everyone will love it! Submitted by ASOTO Updated on April 11, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 269 269 269 269 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 1 hr Additional Time: 3 hrs Total Time: 4 hrs 15 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 1 (9-inch) flan Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 1 cup white sugar 3 large eggs 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk 1 (12 fluid ounce) can evaporated milk 1 tablespoon vanilla extract Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Melt sugar in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat until liquefied and golden in color. Carefully pour hot syrup into a deep 9-inch round glass baking dish, turning the dish to evenly coat the bottom; set aside. Beat eggs in a large bowl. Add condensed milk, evaporated milk, and vanilla; beat until smooth. Pour egg mixture on top of caramel in the baking dish; place in a deep roasting pan. Carefully pour in enough hot water to come 1 inch up the sides of the dish. Bake in the preheated oven until just set with a slight jiggle in the center, about 1 hour, checking after 55 minutes. Keep in mind the flan will continue to set as it cools. Remove from the oven and carefully transfer baking dish to a wire rack; cool to room temperature, then cover with plastic wrap to prevent a skin forming. Refrigerate for 3 hours or up to 3 days. To serve, run a knife around the edges of the dish; carefully invert onto a rimmed serving plate and let caramel sauce flow over flan. dfdez78 From the Editor This recipe was tested in our test kitchen and updated to include baking the flan in a water bath and not covering with foil. I Made It Print 2,262 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Spanish Flan 01 of 269 Photo by¬† dfdez78 02 of 269 Photo by¬† Matt Shurtleff 02/08/2025 A keeper! Easy to follow Worth the effort Great flavors Followed the recipe exactly using 6 oven safe ramekins for about 40 minutes and it came out perfectly!!! 03 of 269 Photo by¬† Allrecipes Member 02/04/2025 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Crowd-pleaser Family favorite This was well written and easy to follow, I made it for a luncheon I was hosting and from the get go it turned out perfect. I followed the recipe exactly as written, I would not change a thing as it came out perfect. Everybody ate dessert and there were none left. We all loved it. I'm making it again this weekend. Delicious! 04 of 269 Photo by¬† Caroline 10/26/2024 A keeper! Love making this recipe in an instant pot 10-15 min and it‚Äôs done. Add at least 2 cups of water. 05 of 269 Photo by¬† mio 09/19/2024 Easy to follow Crowd-pleaser Family favorite I used this recipe to make chocoflan and the flan was def so yummy! will 100% make it again but by itself lol, super simple if you do it right :)I would rec being fast with the caramel so you can move it around evenly on the pan because it hardens quickly!! 06 of 269 Photo by¬† MerryNori3462 07/24/2024 Easy to follow Crowd-pleaser Great flavors A keeper! Made it once, and it turned out delicious, but the texture was a bit off. Still definitely enjoyed and consumed by all.Just made it again and this time I had access to a more temperature stable oven and a deeper water bath. I also decided to filter out the eggie bits that wouldn't go completely into the batter to (hopefully) improve the texture and... Oh my god. It turned out PERFECT. Absolutely delicious. It's such a delicious and easy recipe. 07 of 269 Photo by¬† SteadyChive1317 06/17/2024 A keeper! Easy to follow Family favorite Delicious!! I made this dessert for the first time. and decided to use 4 eggs instead of 3. My husband really loved it, and I will definitely be making it again and again! 08 of 269 Photo by¬† Cess Oliva 04/17/2024 A keeper! Easy to follow Family favorite Absolutely delicious and easy to make! We followed the tip to keep the pan heated and used 5 eggs instead of 3. Delicious!! 09 of 269 Photo by¬† SoapyFork3491 02/14/2024 It is a lovely flan. I didn't change the recipe, I followed it exactly as it . Some people are very rude with their reviews and maybe it is because they don't follow the steps. I did it, and thank you for taking the effort to help us out with cooking and baking 10 of 269 Photo by¬† SneakyBao3336 02/09/2024 Easy to follow Great flavors Worth the effort Crowd-pleaser A keeper! This is my very first recipe ever! Yet, I tasted the Spanish Flan and it was so moist with great sweetness, but it has slightly less sugar unlike with the Mexican Flan, which that type of dessert takes longer process with ingredients, cooking time, and more sweet with sugar than the European Flan in general. Overall, it was very quick and simple made recipe üòã üëå. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You‚Äôll Also Love 7 Absolutely Irresistible Mexican Flan Recipes Sous Vide Flan 12 Ratings Microwave Flan 25 Ratings Flan de Queso (Cream Cheese Flan) 64 Ratings Coconut Milk Flan 17 Ratings Pumpkin Flan Coconut Flan 50 Ratings Aracely's Flan 40 Ratings Flan de Coco (Coconut Flan) 128 Ratings Baked Flan 514 Ratings Caramel-Glazed Flan 119 Ratings Creamy Caramel Flan 705 Ratings Super Easy Cream Cheese Flan 5 Ratings White Chocolate Flan 4 Ratings What Is Flan? name: ASOTO
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).;Melt sugar in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat until liquefied and golden in color. Carefully pour hot syrup into a deep 9-inch round glass baking dish, turning the dish to evenly coat the bottom; set aside.;Beat eggs in a large bowl. Add condensed milk, evaporated milk, and vanilla; beat until smooth. Pour egg mixture on top of caramel in the baking dish; place in a deep roasting pan. Carefully pour in enough hot water to come 1 inch up the sides of the dish.;Bake in the preheated oven until just set with a slight jiggle in the center, about 1 hour, checking after 55 minutes. Keep in mind the flan will continue to set as it cools. Remove from the oven and carefully transfer baking dish to a wire rack; cool to room temperature, then cover with plastic wrap to prevent a skin forming. Refrigerate for 3 hours or up to 3 days.;To serve, run a knife around the edges of the dish; carefully invert onto a rimmed serving plate and let caramel sauce flow over flan. dfdez78
